did.head: Descriptive Summary

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to all researchers.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Restrictions may apply concerning the use, photoduplication, or publication of items in this collection. Consult a member of the archives staff for information concerning these restrictions. The user assumes all responsibility for identifying and satisfying any claimants of copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Shenandoah County Butcher Records, Collection # 383 WFCHS, Stewart Bell Jr. Archives, Handley Regional Library, Winchester, VA, USA.

altformavail.head: Alternative Form Available
altformavail.p: The Genealogical Society of Utah digitized materials from this collection in 2007. These copies are available in DVD in the Archives Reading Room. The account book may also be viewed Stewart Bell Jr. Digital Archives

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: The Shenandoah County Butcher Records collection contains one account book belonging to an unidentified butcher working in Woodstock and Edinburg, Shenandoah County, VA. Entries cover the years 1859 to 1860.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Shenandoah County was established in 1772. Woodstock and Edinburg are towns in the County.
